com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya

Class StringUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.StringUtils

  • @NotFullyTested
public final class StringUtils
extends Object
    This is a collection of methods to manipulate String references.
    Author:
    Kevin Connor ARPE (kevinarpe@gmail.com)

    • Field Detail

      • NEW_LINE

        public static final String NEW_LINE
        This is the current newline: System.getProperty("line.separator"). This will differ between operating systems, such as UNIX variants and Microsoft Windows.

        It is also available when calling String.format(String, Object...) and using %n in the format string.

        See Also:
        NEW_LINE, UNIX_NEW_LINE, WINDOWS_NEW_LINE

      • UNIX_NEW_LINE

        public static final String UNIX_NEW_LINE
        This is the newline used by UNIX variants: "\n". This value will never differ between operating systems.

      • WINDOWS_NEW_LINE

        public static final String WINDOWS_NEW_LINE
        This is the newline used by Microsoft Windows: "\r\n". This value will never differ between operating systems.

    • Method Detail

      • parseBoolean

        public static boolean parseBoolean(String str)
        Strictly converts a string to a boolean value. Ignoring case, only "true" and "false" are accepted as valid values. The built-in Java method, Boolean.parseBoolean(String), is more lenient, treating "true" (or case variants) as true and all other values, including null, as false.
        Parameters:
        str - input value
        Returns:
        boolean value
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if str is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if str is not "true" or "false", ignoring case
        See Also:
        FuncUtils.PARSE_BOOLEAN_FROM_STRING

      • trimWhitespacePrefix

        public static String trimWhitespacePrefix(String str)
        Creates a copy of the input string, but removes all leading whitespace chars. To be precise, "leading" is always defined as starting from index zero. This terminology may be backwards for right-to-left languages such as Hebrew and Arabic.

        Whitespace is defined as Character.isWhitespace(char), which will include all Unicode whitespace, such as the Japanese full-width space.

        If zero leading whitespace chars are found, the input string reference is returned.

        If all characters in input string are whitespace, an empty string is returned.

        Parameters:
        str - a string reference
        Returns:
        string reference without leading whitespace chars
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if str is null
        See Also:
        trimWhitespaceSuffix(String)

      • trimWhitespaceSuffix

        public static String trimWhitespaceSuffix(String str)
        Creates a copy of the input string, but removes all trailing whitespace chars. To be precise, "trailing" is always defined as starting from the last index. This terminology may be backwards for right-to-left languages such as Hebrew and Arabic.

        Whitespace is defined by Character.isWhitespace(char), which includes all special whitespace chars used in East Asian languages.

        If zero leading whitespace chars are found, the input string reference is returned.

        If all characters in input string are whitespace, an empty string is returned.

        Parameters:
        str - a string reference
        Returns:
        string reference without leading whitespace chars
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if str is null
        See Also:
        trimWhitespacePrefix(String)

      • isOnlyWhitespace

        public static <T extends CharSequence> boolean isOnlyWhitespace(String str)
        Tests if an input string is one or more whitespace chars. Empty strings are not considered whitespace.

        Whitespace is defined by Character.isWhitespace(char), which includes all special whitespace chars used in East Asian languages.

        Parameters:
        str - input string
        Returns:
        true if only whitespace
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if str is null

      • isEmptyOrWhitespace

        public static <T extends CharSequence> boolean isEmptyOrWhitespace(String str)
        Tests if an input string is empty or one or more whitespace chars.

        Whitespace is defined by Character.isWhitespace(char), which includes all special whitespace chars used in East Asian languages.

        Parameters:
        str - input string
        Returns:
        true if empty or all whitespace
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if str is null

      • substringPrefix

        public static String substringPrefix(String str,
                     int count)
        This method is modeled after Left() from Visual Basic. Copies a specified number of leading chars from a string. To be precise, "leading" is always defined as starting from index zero. This terminology may be backwards for right-to-left languages such as Hebrew and Arabic.

        If count == 0, the empty string is retured.

        If count >= str.length(), the input string reference is returned.

        Parameters:
        str - input string reference to process
        count - number of chars to copy starting from first index. Must be >= 0, and may be greater than input length
        Returns:
        string reference created from leading chars
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if str is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if count is negative

      • substringSuffix

        public static String substringSuffix(String str,
                     int count)
        This method is modeled after Right() from Visual Basic. Copies a specified number of trailing chars from a string. To be precise, "trailing" is always defined as starting from the last index. This terminology may be backwards for right-to-left languages such as Hebrew and Arabic.

        If count == 0, the empty string is retured.

        If count >= str.length(), the input string reference is returned.

        Parameters:
        str - input string reference to process
        count - number of chars to copy starting from last index. Must be >= 0, and may be greater than input length
        Returns:
        string reference created from trailing chars
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if str is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if count is negative

      • replaceAll

        public static String replaceAll(String haystack,
                Pattern regex,
                String replacement)

      • findLastPatternMatch

        public static int findLastPatternMatch(String haystack,
                       Pattern regex)

      • remove

        public static String remove(String s,
            int index)
        This is a convenience method for remove(String, int, int) where count = 1.

      • remove

        public static String remove(String str,
            int index,
            int count)
        Removes characters from a string by creating a new string and copying remaining characters from the source string. To be precise, using the term "remove" is a misnomer, as Java strings cannot change size.

        If count == 0, the input string reference is returned. No copy is made.

        Parameters:
        str - a string reference
        index - offset to begin removing characters. Range: 0 to str.length() - 1
        count - number of characters to remove. Must be non-negative.
        Returns:
        reference to a string with characters removed
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if str is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if index and count are invalid

      • insert

        public static String insert(String str,
            int index,
            String newText)
        Insert characters into a string by creating a new string and copying characters from the source strings. To be precise, using the term "insert" is a misnomer, as Java strings cannot change size.

        If count == 0, the input string reference is returned. No copy is made.

        Parameters:
        str - a string reference
        index - offset to begin inserting characters. Range: 0 to str.length()
        newText - characters to insert
        Returns:
        reference to a string with characters inserted
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if str or newText is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if index is invalid

      • replace

        public static String replace(String str,
             int index,
             String newText)
        This is a convenience method to combine remove(String, int, int) and insert(String, int, String) where count = 1.

      • replace

        public static String replace(String str,
             int index,
             int count,
             String newText)
        This is a convenience method to combine remove(String, int, int) and insert(String, int, String).
